name: sadness soup
description:
photography + digital intervention + poetry

I wrote this poem by a real feeling of wating to become a chicken soup. That was a time I used to be very sad, and my way to get better was to stay in the bathtub long enough to write a poem, and this one came out. 

The original language is Spanish, but I translated it if you'd like to read it in english:

I want to
be cooked 
by this bathtub
and wait for my skin
to turn white,
like a chicken broth.

I wish I was not so sad.

When I’m sad, 
I’d like you
to peel potatoes,
throw them 
in the bathtub,
and leave 
the salt aside
just in case
I don’t produce
enough flavor. 

Try me with 
a teaspoon
every certain time
before I lift the plug
and it’s too late
to get it all back.
